abstract: Robert Christie, who joined The Times in 2010 from The Wall Street Journal, is leaving as senior vice president of corporate communications, and his position is being eliminated.
snippet: Robert Christie, who joined The Times in 2010 from The Wall Street Journal, is leaving as senior vice president of corporate communications, and his position is being eliminated.
lead_paragraph: 1:25 p.m. | Updated Robert Christie, senior vice president of corporate communications for The New York Times Company, is leaving the company and his position is being eliminated, The Times announced Wednesday.
